subject: Re: From The TDA7000 to digital recorder
author: Jill
full_text:
Frank, what's your opinion on plugging directly into the board versus recording in the room?  I'm curious, because I know that if I try to record without plugging directly into the box, I don't hear much of anything -- it's only when I record the box directly (as well as a mic into which I ask my questions) that I hear all the numerous responses on playback. 

Jill



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>
>  27 seconds "Frank we'll save you", 35 seconds "this is progress", at 55
> seconds "We prove Norma(wife)", and at the end, "Record--Our Princess". I'm
> using an Olympus WS-210S and I use a line adapter to plug directly into the
> board instead of recording open air.
> 
>  F-S
>
